question: Claire Polosak, the first woman to officiate in men’s test match, is from which country?
explanation:
Australia’s Claire Polosak became the first woman to officiate at a men’s Test match, when she served as the fourth umpire during the test match between India and Australia in Sydney.
Australia’s new edition of the National anthem was also sung during the match. She was also the first woman to officiate on-field in a men’s one-day international and the first woman umpire to stand in an Australian men’s domestic fixture.
